page.title: 06RATLINGHOPE MILL
page.content: {Ratlinghope Mill}and part of the wheel house is made of stone. The floor of the upper room of the mill is broken-up.{There is no wheel}in the wheel-house but there is a hole in the floor where it went.There is a cow house with no roof and a Dutch barn made of corrugated iron. {The mill-stones were broken-up}and were in the yard or in the lane hedges. The stables were brick with a tiled roof.The pig-pen was brick with a corrugated roof.The mill house is made of brick.{The earth closet}in the garden is still used. The mill race is like a dried-up stream and the pond behind the mill is empty.The overflow runs into an old sheep-dip then back into Darnford Brook.
